content.description: There are actually a few edges on this one. Has recently been rebolted with modern hardware.
content.location: Middle of the three slab routes

climbs.name: I've Fallen and I Can't Get Up

content.description: Clip a bolt just up and right of a 2-bolt anchor. After first bolt, mantle on good edges over a lip, then cruise on easier terrain. ends at 2 bolts without rap rings, but you can easily traverse right to anchors of Damage (10d) and rap of those rings if needed.
content.location: Starts from the anchor on the far right end of Playground Ledge. Route starts a few feet right of anchor.

content.description: This is a really dumb route. 1 bolt protects a bouldery face move, mantel onto the slab. Then its over. The one move is fun, but its weird this was bolted.
content.location: The solitary bolt off of Playground ledge leads to a ring anchor. Bolt has been updated to modern SS.

content.description: Pinpoint feet, thin sloping fingers and a thumb press on slab finishing into a committing fall to grab a block.
content.protection: 7 draws. Good idea to place a directional off the bolt above the rap station or risk breaking a leg going for the first bolt
content.location: Past the aid boulder on climberâ€™s right. Continue to the rap station far right and its the 3 traversing bolts that lead to the right and continue upwards

content.description:
A contrived squeeze job.

Tricky thin slab climbing, much harder if you avoid climbing into the route to the left, easier if you do.
content.location: Right most route on the slab

content.description: from the anchors, climb up a few moves, involving a high-step onto a foot-sized sloping ledge from which you can clip the first bolt (this is where Flounder 11d heads right), then use some edges on the red granite on your left to reach the next bolt. Continue on easier ground to anchor with rap rings.
content.location: anchor is 20 feet right and 10 feet down from anchors at far right side of Playground Ledge. Can be TR'd after climbing I've Fallen and I Can't Get Up (10c), which also avoids getting to down to those anchors if you happen to already be on playground ledge.

content.description: A thin delicate slab. The upper portion has no hands, no feet. Pretty much just friction.
